010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
015import java.io.PrintStream;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Locale;
018
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
024import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException;
025import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
026import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
027import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException;
028
029import imagingbook.common.math.exception.DivideByZeroException;
030
031/**
032 * <p>This class defines a set of static methods for calculations
033 * with vectors and matrices using native Java arrays without any enclosing 
034 * object structures. 
035 * Matrices are simple two-dimensional arrays A[r][c], where r is the row index
036 * and c is the column index (as common in linear algebra). This means that
037 * matrices are really vectors of row vectors.
038 * Only arrays of type {@code float} and {@code double} are supported.
039 * All matrices are assumed to be rectangular (i.e., all rows are of equal length).
040 * </p>
041 * <p>
042 * Note: Methods named with a trailing 'D' (e.g., {@link #multiplyD(double, double[])}) 
043 * operate destructively, i.e., modify one of the passed arguments.
044 * </p>
045 * 
046 * @author WB
047 * @version 2022/08/29
048 */
049public abstract class Matrix {
050        
051        private Matrix() {}
052        
053        // TODO: check if these variables should be public and non-final
054        
055        /** Locale used for printing decimal numbers by {@code toString()} methods. */
056        public static Locale PrintLocale = Locale.US;
057        
058        /** Character used to separate successive vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
059        public static char SeparationChar = ',';
060        
061        /** Leading delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
062        public static char LeftDelimitChar = '{';
063        
064        /** Trailing delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
065        public static char RightDelimitChar = '}';
066        
067        // ----  Matrix creation -----------------------------
068        
069        /**
070         * <p>Creates and returns a {@code double[][]} matrix containing the specified values.
071         * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the number of supplied values does
072         * not exactly match the matrix size. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
073         * </p>
074         * <pre>
075         * double[][] A = makeDoubleMatrix(2, 3, 
076         *              1.0, 2.0, 3.0,
077         *              4.0, 5.0, 6.0 );</pre>
078         * <p>
079         * See also {@link #flatten(double[][])}.
080         * </p>
081         * 
082         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
083         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
084         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code double[]})
085         * @return a {@code double[][]} matrix
086         */
087        public static double[][] makeDoubleMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
088                final double[][] A = new double[rows][cols];
089                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
090                        return A;
091                }
092                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
093                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
094                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
095                }
096                
097                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
098                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
099                                A[r][c] = values[i];
100                                i++;
101                        }
102                }               
103                return A;
104        }
105        
106        /**
107         * <p>
108         * Creates and returns a {@code float[][]} matrix containing the specified values.
109         * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the number of supplied values does
110         * not exactly match the matrix size. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
111         * </p>
112         * <pre>
113         * float[][] A = makeFloatMatrix(2, 3, 
114         *              1.0f, 2.0f, 3.0f,
115         *              4.0f, 5.0f, 6.0f );</pre>
116         * <p>
117         * See also {@link #flatten(float[][])}.
118         * </p>
119         * 
120         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
121         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
122         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code float[]})
123         * @return a {@code float[][]} matrix
124         */
125        public static float[][] makeFloatMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final float... values) {
126                final float[][] A = new float[rows][cols];
127                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
128                        return A;
129                }
130                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
131                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
132                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
133                }       
134                
135                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
136                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
137                                A[r][c] = values[i];
138                                i++;
139                        }
140                }               
141                return A;
142        }
143        
144        /**
145         * <p>
146         * Creates and returns a {@link RealMatrix} containing the specified {@code double} values.
147         * Calls {@link #makeDoubleMatrix(int, int, double...)}. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
148         * </p>
149         * <pre>
150         * RealMatrix A = makeRealMatrix(2, 3, 
151         *              1.0, 2.0, 3.0,
152         *              4.0, 5.0, 6.0 );</pre>
153         * <p>
154         * See also {@link #flatten(RealMatrix)}.
155         * </p>
156         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
157         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
158         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code double[]})
159         * @return a {@link RealMatrix} 
160         */
161        public static RealMatrix makeRealMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
162                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(makeDoubleMatrix(rows, cols, values));
163        }
164        
165
166        /**
167         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code double[]}
168         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
169         * The matrix must be fully rectangular (all rows of same length).
170         * See also {@link #makeDoubleMatrix(int, int, double...)}.
171         *  
172         * @param A a matrix
173         * @return a {@code double[]} with the matrix elements
174         */
175        public static double[] flatten(double[][] A) {
176                final int rows = A.length;
177                final int cols = A[0].length;
178                final double[] vals = new double[rows * cols];
179                int i = 0;
180                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
181                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
182                                vals[i] = A[r][c];
183                                i++;
184                        }
185                }
186                return vals;
187        }
188        
189        /**
190         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code float[]}
191         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
192         * The matrix must be fully rectangular (all rows of same length).
193         * See also {@link #makeFloatMatrix(int, int, float...)}.
194         *  
195         * @param A a matrix
196         * @return a {@code float[]} with the matrix elements
197         */
198        public static float[] flatten(float[][] A) {
199                final int rows = A.length;
200                final int cols = A[0].length;
201                final float[] vals = new float[rows * cols];
202                int i = 0;
203                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
204                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
205                                vals[i] = A[r][c];
206                                i++;
207                        }
208                }
209                return vals;
210        }
211        
212        /**
213         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code double[]}
214         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
215         * See also {@link #makeRealMatrix(int, int, double...)}.
216         *  
217         * @param A a matrix
218         * @return a {@code double[]} with the matrix elements
219         */
220        public static double[] flatten(RealMatrix A) {
221                return flatten(A.getData());
222        }
223        
224        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
225        
226        /**
227         * Creates and returns a {@code double[]} vector from the
228         * specified values.
229         * 
230         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code double[]})
231         * @return a {@code double[]}
232         */
233        public static double[] makeDoubleVector(double... values) {
234                return values;
235        }
236        
237        /**
238         * Creates and returns a {@code float[]} vector from the
239         * specified values.
240         * 
241         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code float[]})
242         * @return a {@code float[]}
243         */
244        public static float[] makeFloatVector(float... values) {
245                return values;
246        }
247        
248        /**
249         * Creates and returns a {@link RealVector} from the
250         * specified {@code double} values.
251         * 
252         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code double[]})
253         * @return a {@link RealVector} 
254         */
255        public static RealVector makeRealVector(double... values) {
256                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(values);
257//              return new ArrayRealVector(values);
258        }
259        
260        // Specific vector/matrix creation:
261        
262        /**
263         * Creates and returns a new zero-valued {@code double[]} vector of the 
264         * specified length.
265         * Throws an exception if the length is less than 1.
266         * @param length the length of the vector
267         * @return a {@code double[]} with zero values
268         */
269        public static double[] zeroVector(int length) {
270                if (length < 1)
271                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vector size cannot be < 1");
272                return new double[length];
273        }
274        
275        /**
276         * Creates and returns a new identity matrix of the 
277         * specified size.
278         * Throws an exception if the size is less than 1.
279         * @param size the size of the matrix
280         * @return an identity matrix
281         */
282        public static double[][] idMatrix(int size) {
283                if (size < 1)
284                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix size cannot be < 1");
285                double[][] A = new double[size][size];
286                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
287                        A[i][i] = 1;
288                }
289                return A;
290        }
291        
292        // Matrix properties -------------------------------------
293
294        /**
295         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@code double} matrix.
296         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
297         * @return the number of rows
298         */
299        public static int getNumberOfRows(double[][] A) {
300                return A.length;
301        }
302        
303        
304        /**
305         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@code double} matrix.
306         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
307         * @return the number of columns
308         */
309        public static int getNumberOfColumns(double[][] A) {
310                return A[0].length;
311        }
312        
313        /**
314         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@code float} matrix.
315         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
316         * @return the number of rows
317         */
318        public static int getNumberOfRows(float[][] A) {
319                return A.length;
320        }
321        
322        /**
323         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@code float} matrix.
324         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
325         * @return the number of columns
326         */
327        public static int getNumberOfColumns(float[][] A) {
328                return A[0].length;
329        }
330        
331        /**
332         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@link RealMatrix}.
333         * @param A a {@link RealMatrix}
334         * @return the number of rows
335         */
336        public static int getNumberOfRows(RealMatrix A) {
337                return A.getRowDimension();
338        }
339        
340        /**
341         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@link RealMatrix}.
342         * @param A a {@link RealMatrix}
343         * @return the number of columns
344         */
345        public static int getNumberOfColumns(RealMatrix A) {
346                return A.getColumnDimension();
347        }
348        
349        // Extract rows or columns
350        
351        /**
352         * Returns a particular row of the specified {@code double} matrix 
353         * as a {@code double} vector.
354         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
355         * @param r the row index (starting with 0)
356         * @return a {@code double} vector
357         */
358        public static double[] getRow(double[][] A, int r) {
359                return A[r].clone();
360        }
361        
362        /**
363         * Returns a particular row of the specified {@code float} matrix 
364         * as a {@code float} vector.
365         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
366         * @param r the row index (starting with 0)
367         * @return a {@code float} vector
368         */
369        public static float[] getRow(float[][] A, int r) {
370                return A[r].clone();
371        }
372        
373        /**
374         * Returns a particular column of the specified {@code double} matrix 
375         * as a {@code double} vector.
376         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
377         * @param c the column index (starting with 0)
378         * @return a {@code double} vector
379         */
380        public static double[] getColumn(double[][] A, int c) {
381                final int rows = A.length;
382                double[] col = new double[rows];
383                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
384                        col[r] = A[r][c];
385                }
386                return col;
387        }
388        
389        /**
390         * Returns a particular column of the specified {@code float} matrix 
391         * as a {@code float} vector.
392         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
393         * @param c the column index (starting with 0)
394         * @return a {@code float} vector
395         */
396        public static float[] getColumn(float[][] A, int c) {
397                final int rows = A.length;
398                float[] col = new float[rows];
399                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
400                        col[r] = A[r][c];
401                }
402                return col;
403        }
404        
405        // Checking vector/matrix dimensions
406        
407        /**
408         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
409         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
410         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
411         */
412        public static boolean isRectangular(float[][] A) {
413                final int nCols = A[0].length;
414                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
415                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
416                                return false;
417                        }
418                }
419                return true;
420        }
421        
422        /**
423         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
424         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
425         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
426         */
427        public static boolean isRectangular(double[][] A) {
428                final int nCols = A[0].length;
429                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
430                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
431                                return false;
432                        }
433                }
434                return true;
435        }
436        
437        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
438         * and columns.
439         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
440         * @return true iff the matrix is square
441         */
442        public static boolean isSquare(double[][] A) {
443                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
444        }
445        
446        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
447         * and columns.
448         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
449         * @return true iff the matrix is square
450         */
451        public static boolean isSquare(float[][] A) {
452                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
453        }
454        
455        /**
456         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
457         * @param A a square {@code double[][]} matrix
458         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
459         */
460        public static double[] getDiagonal(double[][] A) {
461                if (!isSquare(A)) {
462                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
463                }
464                final int n = A.length;
465                double[] diag = new double[n];
466                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
467                        diag[i] = A[i][i];
468                }
469                return diag;
470        }
471        
472        /**
473         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
474         * @param A a square {@code float[][]} matrix
475         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
476         */
477        public static float[] getDiagonal(float[][] A) {
478                if (!isSquare(A)) {
479                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
480                }
481                final int n = A.length;
482                float[] diag = new float[n];
483                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
484                        diag[i] = A[i][i];
485                }
486                return diag;
487        }
488        
489        /**
490         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
491         * @param A a square {@link RealMatrix}
492         * @return the {@link RealVector} of diagonal elements
493         */
494        public static RealVector getDiagonal(RealMatrix A) {
495                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(getDiagonal(A.getData()));
496        }
497        
498        /**
499         * Creates and returns a diagonal matrix from the specified 
500         * vector. See also {@link #getDiagonal(double[][])}.
501         * 
502         * @param d vector of diagonal matrix elements
503         * @return a diagonal matrix
504         */
505        public double[][] diagMatrix(double[] d) {
506                return MatrixUtils.createRealDiagonalMatrix(d).getData();
507        }
508        
509        /**
510         * Checks is the given square {@code double[][]} matrix is non-singular.
511         * @param A a square {@code double[][]} matrix
512         * @return true if the matrix is singular
513         */
514        public static boolean isSingular(double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
515                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
516                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
517                }       
518                return isSingular(new Array2DRowRealMatrix(A));
519        }
520        
521        /**
522         * Checks is the given square matrix is non-singular.
523         * @param A a square {@link RealMatrix}
524         * @return true if the matrix is singular
525         */
526        public static boolean isSingular(RealMatrix A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
527                if (!A.isSquare()) {
528                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
529                }               
530                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
531                return !solver.isNonSingular();
532        }
533        
534        /** Default matrix symmetry tolerance. */
535        public static final double DefaultSymmetryTolerance = 1e-12;
536        
537        /**
538         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric
539         * using the specified relative tolerance.
540         * @param A a square matrix
541         * @param relTolerance relative symmetry tolerance
542         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
543         */
544        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A, double relTolerance) {
545                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(A, relTolerance);
546        }
547        
548        /**
549         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric,
550         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
551         * @param A a square matrix
552         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
553         */
554        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A) {
555                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
556        }
557        
558        /**
559         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric
560         * using the specified relative tolerance.
561         * @param A a square matrix
562         * @param relTolerance relative symmetry tolerance
563         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
564         */
565        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A, double relTolerance) {
566                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), relTolerance);
567        }
568        
569        /**
570         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric,
571         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
572         * @param A a square matrix
573         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
574         */
575        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A) {
576                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
577        }
578        
579        /**
580         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite,
581         * using the specified symmetry tolerance value.
582         * 
583         * @param A a square matrix
584         * @param tolerance the absolute positivity and relative symmetry tolerance
585         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
586         */
587        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A, double tolerance) { //TODO: split tolerance in two parameters
588                try {
589                        new CholeskyDecomposition(A, tolerance, tolerance);
590                        return true;
591                } catch (NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException e) {};
592                return false;
593        }
594        
595        /**
596         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite.
597         * @param A a square matrix
598         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
599         */
600        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A) {
601                return isPositiveDefinite(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
602        }
603        
604        /**
605         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
606         * @param a first vector
607         * @param b second vector
608         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
609         */
610        public static boolean sameSize(double[] a, double[] b) {
611                return a.length == b.length;
612        }
613        
614        /**
615         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
616         * @param a first vector
617         * @param b second vector
618         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
619         */
620        public static boolean sameSize(float[] a, float[] b) {
621                return a.length == b.length;
622        }
623        
624        /**
625         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
626         * @param A first matrix
627         * @param B second matrix
628         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
629         */
630        public static boolean sameSize(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
631                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
632        }
633        
634        /**
635         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
636         * @param A first matrix
637         * @param B second matrix
638         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
639         */
640        public static boolean sameSize(float[][] A, float[][] B) {
641                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
642        }
643
644        // Matrix and vector duplication ------------------------------
645
646        /**
647         * Returns a copy of the given {@code double[]} vector. 
648         * @param a a {@code double[]} vector
649         * @return a copy of the vector
650         */
651        public static double[] duplicate(final double[] a) {
652                return a.clone();
653        }
654        
655        /**
656         * Returns a copy of the given {@code float[]} vector. 
657         * @param a a {@code float[]} vector
658         * @return a copy of the vector
659         */
660        public static float[] duplicate(final float[] a) {
661                return a.clone();
662        }
663
664        /**
665         * Returns a copy of the given {@code double[][]} matrix. 
666         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
667         * @return a copy of the matrix
668         */
669        public static double[][] duplicate(final double[][] A) {
670                final int m = A.length;
671                final double[][] B = new double[m][];
672                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
673                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
674                }
675                return B;
676        }
677        
678        /**
679         * Returns a copy of the given {@code float[][]} matrix. 
680         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
681         * @return a copy of the matrix
682         */
683        public static float[][] duplicate(final float[][] A) {
684                final int m = A.length;
685                float[][] B = new float[m][];
686                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
687                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
688                }
689                return B;
690        }
691        
692        // vector copying ------------------------------
693        
694        /**
695         * Copy data from one {@code float[]} vector to another.
696         * The two vectors must have the same length (not checked).
697         * @param source the source vector (unmodified)
698         * @param target the target vector (modified)
699         */
700        public static void copyD(float[] source, float[] target) {
701                System.arraycopy(source, 0, target, 0, source.length);
702        }
703        
704        /**
705         * Copy data from one {@code double[]} vector to another.
706         * The two vectors must have the same length (not checked).
707         * @param source the source vector (unmodified)
708         * @param target the target vector (modified)
709         */
710        public static void copyD(double[] source, double[] target) {
711                System.arraycopy(source, 0, target, 0, source.length);
712        }
713        
714        // ----- double <-> float conversions -----------------
715        
716        /**
717         * Converts a {@code double[]} to a {@code float[]}.
718         * @param a the original {@code double[]} array
719         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code float[]}
720         */
721        public static float[] toFloat(final double[] a) {
722                final int m = a.length;
723                final float[] b = new float[m];
724                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
725                        b[i] = (float) a[i];
726                }
727                return b;
728        }
729        
730        /**
731         * Converts a {@code double[][]} to a {@code float[][]}.
732         * @param A the original {@code double[][]} array
733         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code float[][]}
734         */
735        public static float[][] toFloat(final double[][] A) {
736                final int m = A.length;
737                final int n = A[0].length;
738                final float[][] B = new float[m][n];
739                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
740                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
741                                B[i][j] = (float) A[i][j];
742                        }
743                }
744                return B;
745        }
746        
747        /**
748         * Converts a {@code float[]} to a {@code double[]}.
749         * @param a the original {@code float[]} array
750         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code double[]}
751         */
752        public static double[] toDouble(final float[] a) {
753                final int m = a.length;
754                final double[] B = new double[m];
755                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
756                        B[i] = a[i];
757                }
758                return B;
759        }
760        
761        /**
762         * Converts a {@code float[][]} to a {@code double[][]}.
763         * @param A the original {@code float[][]} array
764         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code double[][]}
765         */
766        public static double[][] toDouble(final float[][] A) {
767                final int m = A.length;
768                final int n = A[0].length;
769                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
770                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
771                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
772                                B[i][j] = A[i][j];
773                        }
774                }
775                return B;
776        }
777        
778        // ----------- fill operations (destructive) ------------------------
779        
780        /**
781         * Fills the given {@code double} vector with the specified value (destructively).
782         * @param x a vector (which is modified)
783         * @param val the fill value
784         */
785        public static void fillD(final double[] x, double val) {
786                Arrays.fill(x, val);
787        }
788        
789        /**
790         * Fills the given {@code float} vector with the specified value (destructively).
791         * @param x a vector (which is modified)
792         * @param val the fill value
793         */
794        public static void fillD(final float[] x, float val) {
795                Arrays.fill(x, val);
796        }
797        
798        /**
799         * Fills the given {@code double} matrix with the specified value (destructively).
800         * @param A a matrix (which is modified)
801         * @param val the fill value
802         */
803        public static void fillD(final double[][] A, double val) {
804                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
805                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
806                }
807        }
808        
809        /**
810         * Fills the given {@code float} matrix with the specified value (destructively).
811         * @param A a matrix (which is modified)
812         * @param val the fill value
813         */
814        public static void fillD(final float[][] A, float val) {
815                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
816                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
817                }
818        }
819        
820
821        // Element-wise arithmetic -------------------------------
822        
823        /**
824         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code double} vectors
825         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
826         * different lengths.
827         * None of the arguments is modified.
828         * @param a the first vector
829         * @param b the second vector
830         * @return a new {@code double} vector
831         */
832        public static double[] add(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
833                double[] c = b.clone();
834                addD(a, c);
835                return c;
836        }
837        
838        /**
839         * Adds the elements of the first {@code double} vector
840         * to the second vector (destructively).
841         * An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
842         * different lengths.
843         * The second vector is modified.
844         * @param a the first vector
845         * @param b the second vector
846         */
847        public static void addD(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
848                if (!sameSize(a, b))
849                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
850                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
851                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
852                }
853        }
854        
855        /**
856         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code float} vectors
857         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
858         * different lengths.
859         * None of the arguments is modified.
860         * @param a the first vector
861         * @param b the second vector
862         * @return a new {@code float} vector
863         */
864        public static float[] add(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
865                float[] c = b.clone();
866                addD(a, c);
867                return c;
868        }
869        
870        /**
871         * Adds the elements of the first {@code float} vector
872         * to the second vector (destructively).
873         * An exception is thrown if the vectors are of different lengths.
874         * The second vector is modified.
875         * @param a the first vector
876         * @param b the second vector
877         */
878        public static void addD(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
879                if (!sameSize(a, b))
880                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
881                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
882                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
883                }
884        }
885
886        /**
887         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code double} matrix
888         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
889         * different size.
890         * None of the arguments is modified.
891         * @param A the first matrix
892         * @param B the second matrix
893         * @return a new {@code double} matrix
894         */
895        public static double[][] add(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
896                double[][] C = duplicate(B);
897                addD(A, C);
898                return C;
899        }
900        
901        /**
902         * Adds the elements of the first {@code double} matrix
903         * to the second vector (destructively).
904         * An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
905         * different size.
906         * The second matrix is modified.
907         * @param A the first matrix
908         * @param B the second matrix
909         */
910        public static void addD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
911                if (!sameSize(A, B))
912                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
913                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
914                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
915                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
916                        }
917                }
918        }
919        
920        /**
921         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code float} matrix
922         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
923         * different size.
924         * None of the arguments is modified.
925         * @param A the first matrix
926         * @param B the second matrix
927         * @return a new {@code float} matrix
928         */
929        public static float[][] add(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
930                float[][] C = duplicate(B);
931                addD(A, C);
932                return C;
933        }
934        
935        /**
936         * Adds the elements of the first {@code float} matrix
937         * to the second vector (destructively).
938         * An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
939         * different size.
940         * The second matrix is modified.
941         * @param A the first matrix
942         * @param B the second matrix
943         */
944        public static void addD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
945                if (!sameSize(A, B))
946                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
947                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
948                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
949                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
950                        }
951                }
952        }
953        
954        // ------------------------------------------------
955        
956        /**
957         * Calculates and returns the difference (a - b) of the specified {@code double} vectors
958         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
959         * different lengths.
960         * None of the arguments is modified.
961         * @param a the first vector
962         * @param b the second vector
963         * @return a new {@code double} vector
964         */
965        public static double[] subtract(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
966                if (!sameSize(a, b))
967                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
968                final int n = a.length;
969                double[] c = new double[n];
970                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
971                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
972                }
973                return c;
974        }
975        
976        // non-destructive a - b
977        /**
978         * Calculates and returns the difference (a - b) of the specified {@code float} vectors
979         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
980         * different lengths.
981         * None of the arguments is modified.
982         * @param a the first vector
983         * @param b the second vector
984         * @return a new {@code float} vector
985         */
986        public static float[] subtract(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
987                if (!sameSize(a, b))
988                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
989                final int n = a.length;
990                float[] c = new float[n];
991                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
992                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
993                }
994                return c;
995        }
996
997        // Scalar multiplications -------------------------------
998
999        // non-destructive
1000        /**
1001         * Multiplies a {@code double[]} vector by a scalar and returns a new
1002         * {@code double[]} vector (non-destructive).
1003         * @param s a scalar
1004         * @param x a vector
1005         * @return a new vector
1006         */
1007        public static double[] multiply(final double s, final double[] x) {
1008                double[] b = x.clone();
1009                multiplyD(s, b);
1010                return b;
1011        }
1012        
1013        // destructive
1014        /**
1015         * Multiplies a {@code double[]} vector by a scalar.
1016         * Destructive, i.e., the specified vector is modified.
1017         * @param s a scalar
1018         * @param x a vector
1019         */
1020        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[] x) {
1021                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1022                        x[i] = x[i] * s;
1023                }
1024        }
1025        
1026        // non-destructive
1027        /**
1028         * Multiplies a {@code double[][]} matrix by a scalar and returns a new
1029         * {@code double[][]} matrix (non-destructive).
1030         * @param s a scalar
1031         * @param A a matrix
1032         * @return a new matrix
1033         */
1034        public static double[][] multiply(final double s, final double[][] A) {
1035                double[][] B = duplicate(A);
1036                multiplyD(s, B);
1037                return B;
1038        }
1039        
1040        /**
1041         * Multiplies a {@code double[][]} matrix by a scalar.
1042         * Destructive, i.e., the specified matrix is modified.
1043         * @param s a scalar
1044         * @param A a matrix
1045         */
1046        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[][] A) {
1047                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1048                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1049                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
1050                        }
1051                }
1052        }
1053        
1054        // non-destructive
1055        /**
1056         * Multiplies a {@code float[]} vector by a scalar and returns a new
1057         * {@code float[]} vector (non-destructive).
1058         * @param s a scalar
1059         * @param x a vector
1060         * @return a new vector
1061         */
1062        public static float[] multiply(final float s, final float[] x) {
1063                float[] B = duplicate(x);
1064                multiplyD(s, B);
1065                return B;
1066        }
1067        
1068        // destructive
1069        /**
1070         * Multiplies a {@code float[]} vector by a scalar.
1071         * Destructive, i.e., the specified vector is modified.
1072         * @param s a scalar
1073         * @param x a matrix
1074         */
1075        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[] x) {
1076                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1077                        x[i] = x[i] * s;
1078                }
1079        }
1080
1081        // non-destructive
1082        /**
1083         * Multiplies a {@code float[][]} matrix by a scalar and returns a new
1084         * {@code float[][]} matrix (non-destructive).
1085         * @param s a scalar
1086         * @param A a matrix
1087         * @return a new matrix
1088         */
1089        public static float[][] multiply(final float s, final float[][] A) {
1090                float[][] B = duplicate(A);
1091                multiplyD(s, B);
1092                return B;
1093        }
1094        
1095        // destructive
1096        /**
1097         * Multiplies a {@code float[][]} matrix by a scalar.
1098         * Destructive, i.e., the specified matrix is modified.
1099         * @param s a scalar
1100         * @param A a matrix
1101         */
1102        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[][] A) {
1103                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1104                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1105                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
1106                        }
1107                }
1108        }
1109        
1110        // matrix-vector multiplications ----------------------------------------
1111
1112        /**
1113         * Multiplies a vector x with a matrix A "from the left", i.e., y = x * A,
1114         * where x is treated as a row vector and the result y is also a row vector.
1115         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
1116         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1117         * @return a (row) vector of length n
1118         */
1119        public static double[] multiply(final double[] x, final double[][] A) {
1120                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1121                multiplyD(x, A, y);
1122                return y;
1123        }
1124        
1125        /**
1126         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[], double[][])}.
1127         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
1128         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1129         * @param y a (row) vector of length n
1130         */
1131        public static void multiplyD(final double[] x, final double[][] A, double[] y) {
1132                if (x == y) 
1133                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1134                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1135                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1136                if (x.length != m || y.length != n) 
1137                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1138                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1139                        double s = 0;
1140                        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
1141                                s = s + x[j] * A[j][i];
1142                        }
1143                        y[i] = s;
1144                }
1145        }
1146
1147        /**
1148         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1149         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1150         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1151         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1152         * @return a (column) vector of length m
1153         */
1154        public static double[] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[] x) {
1155                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1156                multiplyD(A, x, y);
1157                return y;
1158        }
1159        
1160        /**
1161         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1162         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1163         * The result is placed in the vector passed as the last argument, 
1164         * which is modified.
1165         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[][], double[])}.
1166         * An exception is thrown if any matrix or vector dimensions do not match
1167         * or if the two vectors are the same.
1168         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1169         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1170         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
1171         */
1172        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[] x, double[] y) {
1173                if (x == y) 
1174                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1175                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1176                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1177                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
1178                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1179                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1180                        double s = 0;
1181                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1182                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
1183                        }
1184                        y[i] = s;
1185                }
1186        }
1187        
1188        /**
1189         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
1190         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1191         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1192         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1193         * @return a (column) vector of length m
1194         */
1195        public static float[] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[] x) {
1196                float[] y = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1197                multiplyD(A, x, y);
1198                return y;
1199        }
1200        
1201        /**
1202         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1203         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1204         * The result is placed in the vector passed as the last argument, 
1205         * which is modified.
1206         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(float[][], float[])}.
1207         * An exception is thrown if any matrix or vector dimensions do not match
1208         * or if the two vectors are the same.
1209         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1210         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1211         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
1212         */
1213        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[] x, float[] y) {
1214                if (x == y) 
1215                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1216                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1217                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1218                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
1219                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1220                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1221                        double s = 0;
1222                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1223                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
1224                        }
1225                        y[i] = (float) s;
1226                }
1227        }
1228        
1229
1230        // Matrix-matrix products ---------------------------------------
1231        
1232        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
1233        /**
1234         * Returns the product of two {@code double[][]} matrices A, B
1235         * as a new {@code double[][]} matrix.
1236         * Non-destructive, i.e., none of the arguments is modified.
1237         * @param A first matrix
1238         * @param B second matrix
1239         * @return the matrix product A * B
1240         */
1241        public static double[][] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
1242                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1243                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1244                if (nA != mB)
1245                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1246                int ma = getNumberOfRows(A);
1247                int nb = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1248                double[][] C = makeDoubleMatrix(ma, nb);
1249                multiplyD(A, B, C);
1250                return C;
1251        }
1252        
1253        // A * B -> C (destructive)
1254        /**
1255         * Calculates the product of two {@code double[][]} matrices A, B
1256         * and places the results in the third {@code double[][]} matrix C,
1257         * which is modified (destructively).
1258         * An exception is thrown if any matrix dimensions do not match
1259         * or if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices.
1260         * @param A first matrix
1261         * @param B second matrix
1262         * @param C the result matrix
1263         */
1264        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B, final double[][] C) 
1265                        throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1266                if (A == C || B == C) 
1267                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1268                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1269                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1270                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1271                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1272                if (nA != mB)
1273                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1274                if (mA != getNumberOfRows(C) || nB != getNumberOfColumns(C))
1275                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of C
1276                
1277                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
1278                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
1279                                double s = 0;
1280                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
1281                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
1282                                }
1283                                C[i][j] = s;
1284                        }
1285                }
1286        }
1287        
1288        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
1289        /**
1290         * Returns the product of two {@code float[][]} matrices A, B
1291         * as a new {@code float[][]} matrix.
1292         * Non-destructive, i.e., none of the arguments is modified.
1293         * @param A first matrix
1294         * @param B second matrix
1295         * @return the matrix product A * B
1296         */
1297        public static float[][] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
1298                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1299                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1300                if (nA != mB)
1301                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1302                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1303                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1304                float[][] C = makeFloatMatrix(mA, nB);
1305                multiplyD(A, B, C);
1306                return C;
1307        }
1308
1309        // A * B -> C (destructive)
1310        /**
1311         * Calculates the product of two {@code float[][]} matrices A, B
1312         * and places the results in the third {@code float[][]} matrix C,
1313         * which is modified (destructively).
1314         * An exception is thrown if any matrix dimensions do not match
1315         * or if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices.
1316         * @param A first matrix
1317         * @param B second matrix
1318         * @param C the result matrix
1319         */
1320        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B, final float[][] C) {
1321                if (A == C || B == C) 
1322                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1323                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1324                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1325                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1326                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1327                if (nA != mB)
1328                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A,B
1329                if (mA != getNumberOfRows(C) || nB != getNumberOfColumns(C))
1330                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of C
1331                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
1332                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
1333                                float s = 0;
1334                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
1335                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
1336                                }
1337                                C[i][j] = s;
1338                        }
1339                }
1340        }
1341        
1342        // Vector-vector products ---------------------------------------
1343        
1344        /**
1345         * Calculates and returns the dot (inner or scalar) product of two vectors,
1346         * which must have the same length.
1347         * Throws an exceptions if vector dimensions do not match.
1348         * @param x first vector
1349         * @param y second vector
1350         * @return the dot product
1351         */
1352        public static double dotProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) {
1353                if (!sameSize(x, y))
1354                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1355                double sum = 0;
1356                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1357                        sum = sum + x[i] * y[i];
1358                }
1359                return sum;
1360        }
1361        
1362        // A is considered a column vector, B is a row vector, of length m, n, resp.
1363        // returns a matrix M of size (m,n).
1364        /**
1365         * Calculates and returns the outer product of two vectors, which is a
1366         * matrix of size (m,n), where m is the length of the first vector and
1367         * m is the length of the second vector.
1368         * @param x first vector (of length m)
1369         * @param y second vector (of length n)
1370         * @return the outer product (matrix)
1371         */
1372        public static double[][] outerProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) {
1373                final int m = x.length;
1374                final int n = y.length;
1375                final double[][] M = new double[m][n];
1376                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1377                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1378                                M[i][j] = x[i] * y[j];
1379                        }
1380                }
1381                return M;
1382        }
1383
1384        //  Vector norms ---------------------------------------------------
1385
1386        /**
1387         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
1388         * @param x a vector
1389         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
1390         */
1391        public static double normL1(final double[] x) {
1392                double sum = 0;
1393                for (double val : x) {
1394                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
1395                }
1396                return sum;
1397        }
1398        
1399        /**
1400         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
1401         * @param x a vector
1402         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
1403         */
1404        public static float normL1(final float[] x) {
1405                double sum = 0;
1406                for (double val : x) {
1407                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
1408                }
1409                return (float) sum;
1410        }
1411
1412        /**
1413         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
1414         * @param x a vector
1415         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
1416         */
1417        public static double normL2(final double[] x) {
1418                return Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
1419        }
1420
1421        /**
1422         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
1423         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
1424         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
1425         * @param x a vector
1426         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
1427         */
1428        public static double normL2squared(final double[] x) {
1429                double sum = 0;
1430                for (double val : x) {
1431                        sum = sum + sqr(val);
1432                }
1433                return sum;
1434        }
1435
1436        /**
1437         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
1438         * @param x a vector
1439         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
1440         */
1441        public static float normL2(final float[] x) {
1442                return (float) Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
1443        }
1444
1445        /**
1446         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
1447         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
1448         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
1449         * @param x a vector
1450         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
1451         */
1452        public static double normL2squared(final float[] x) {
1453                double sum = 0;
1454                for (double val : x) {
1455                        sum = sum + sqr(val);
1456                }
1457                return sum;
1458        }
1459        
1460        // Normalize vectors
1461        
1462        /**
1463         * Normalizes the specified {@code double[]} vector to unit
1464         * (L2) norm and returns the result as a new {@code double[]} vector.
1465         * @param x a vector
1466         * @return the normalized vector
1467         */
1468        public static double[] normalize(final double[] x) {
1469                double[] xx = duplicate(x);
1470                normalizeD(xx);
1471                return xx;
1472        }
1473        
1474        /**
1475         * Normalizes the specified {@code double[]} vector to unit
1476         * (L2) norm. The vector is modified (destructively).
1477         * @param x a vector
1478         */
1479        public static void normalizeD(final double[] x) {
1480                double normx = normL2(x);
1481                if (Arithmetic.isZero(normx))
1482                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot normalize zero-norm vector " + Matrix.toString(x));
1483                multiplyD(1.0 / normx, x);
1484        }
1485        
1486        /**
1487         * Normalizes the specified {@code float[]} vector to unit
1488         * (L2) norm and returns the result as a new {@code float[]} vector.
1489         * @param x a vector
1490         * @return the normalized vector
1491         */
1492        public static float[] normalize(final float[] x) {
1493                float[] xx = duplicate(x);
1494                normalizeD(xx);
1495                return xx;
1496        }
1497        
1498        /**
1499         * Normalizes the specified {@code float[]} vector to unit
1500         * (L2) norm. The vector is modified (destructively).
1501         * @param x a vector
1502         */
1503        public static void normalizeD(final float[] x) {
1504                double normx = normL2(x);
1505                if (Arithmetic.isZero(normx))
1506                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot normalize zero-norm vector");
1507                multiplyD((float) (1.0 / normx), x);
1508        }
1509        
1510        // Distance between vectors ---------------------------------------
1511        
1512        /** 
1513         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1514         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1515         * number of elements.
1516         * @param x first vector
1517         * @param y second vector
1518         * @return the distance
1519         */
1520        public static double distL2(double[] x, double[] y) {
1521                return Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
1522        }
1523        
1524        /** 
1525         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1526         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1527         * number of elements.
1528         * @param x first vector
1529         * @param y second vector
1530         * @return the squared distance
1531         */
1532        public static double distL2squared(double[] x, double[] y) {
1533                double sum = 0;
1534                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1535                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
1536                }
1537                return sum;
1538        }
1539        
1540        /** 
1541         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1542         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1543         * number of elements.
1544         * @param x first vector
1545         * @param y second vector
1546         * @return the distance
1547         */
1548        public static float distL2(float[] x, float[] y) {
1549                return (float) Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
1550        }
1551        
1552        /** 
1553         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1554         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1555         * number of elements.
1556         * @param x first vector
1557         * @param y second vector
1558         * @return the squared distance
1559         */
1560        public static float distL2squared(float[] x, float[] y) {
1561                double sum = 0;
1562                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1563                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
1564                }
1565                return (float) sum;
1566        }
1567        
1568        // Matrix (Froebenius) norm ---------------------------------------
1569        
1570        /**
1571         * Calculates and returns the Froebenius norm of the given matrix.
1572         * @param A a matrix
1573         * @return the norm of the matrix
1574         */
1575        public static double norm(final double[][] A) {
1576                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1577                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1578                double s = 0;
1579                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1580                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1581                                s = s + sqr(A[i][j]);
1582                        }
1583                }
1584                return Math.sqrt(s);
1585        }
1586
1587        // Summation --------------------------------------------------
1588
1589        /**
1590         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1591         * {@code double[]} vector.
1592         * @param x a vector
1593         * @return the sum of vector elements
1594         */
1595        public static double sum(final double[] x) {
1596                double sum = 0;
1597                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1598                        sum = sum + x[i];
1599                }
1600                return sum;
1601        }
1602        
1603        /**
1604         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1605         * {@code double[][]} matrix.
1606         * @param A a matrix
1607         * @return the sum of matrix elements
1608         */
1609        public static double sum(final double[][] A) {
1610                double sum = 0;
1611                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1612                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1613                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1614                        }
1615                }
1616                return sum;
1617        }
1618        
1619        /**
1620         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1621         * {@code float[]} vector.
1622         * @param x a vector
1623         * @return the sum of vector elements
1624         */
1625        public static double sum(final float[] x) {
1626                double sum = 0;
1627                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1628                        sum = sum + x[i];
1629                }
1630                return sum;
1631        }
1632        
1633        /**
1634         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1635         * {@code float[][]} matrix.
1636         * @param A a matrix
1637         * @return the sum of matrix elements
1638         */
1639        public static double sum(final float[][] A) {
1640                double sum = 0;
1641                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1642                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1643                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1644                        }
1645                }
1646                return sum;
1647        }
1648        
1649        // --------------------------------------------------
1650        
1651        /**
1652         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1653         * @param A a matrix
1654         * @param row the row index
1655         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1656         */
1657        public static double sumRow(final double[][] A, final int row) {
1658                return sum(A[row]);
1659        }
1660        
1661        /**
1662         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1663         * @param A a matrix
1664         * @param row the row index
1665         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1666         */
1667        public static double sumRow(final float[][] A, final int row) {
1668                return sum(A[row]);
1669        }
1670        
1671
1672        /**
1673         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1674         * @param A a matrix
1675         * @param col the column index
1676         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1677         */
1678        public static double sumColumn(final double[][] A, final int col) {
1679                double sum = 0;
1680                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1681                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1682                }
1683                return sum;
1684        }
1685        
1686        /**
1687         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1688         * @param A a matrix
1689         * @param col the column index
1690         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1691         */
1692        public static double sumColumn(final float[][] A, final int col) {
1693                double sum = 0;
1694                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1695                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1696                }
1697                return sum;
1698        }
1699        
1700        /**
1701         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1702         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1703         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1704         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1705         */
1706        public static double[] sumRows(final double[][] A) {
1707                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1708                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1709                        double sum = 0;
1710                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1711                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1712                        }
1713                        sumVec[i] = sum;
1714                }
1715                return sumVec;
1716        }
1717        
1718        /**
1719         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1720         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1721         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1722         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1723         */
1724        public static float[] sumRows(final float[][] A) {
1725                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1726                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1727                        double sum = 0;
1728                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1729                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1730                        }
1731                        sumVec[i] = (float) sum;
1732                }
1733                return sumVec;
1734        }
1735        
1736        /**
1737         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1738         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1739         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1740         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1741         */
1742        public static double[] sumColumns(final double[][] A) {
1743                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1744                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1745                        double sum = 0;
1746                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1747                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1748                        }
1749                        sumVec[c] = sum;
1750                }
1751                return sumVec;
1752        }
1753        
1754        /**
1755         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1756         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1757         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1758         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1759         */
1760        public static float[] sumColumns(final float[][] A) {
1761                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1762                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1763                        double sum = 0;
1764                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1765                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1766                        }
1767                        sumVec[c] = (float) sum;
1768                }
1769                return sumVec;
1770        }
1771        
1772        // min/max of vectors ------------------------
1773        
1774        /**
1775         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1776         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1777         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1778         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1779         * 
1780         * @param x a vector
1781         * @return the index of the smallest value
1782         */
1783        public static int idxMin(double[] x) {
1784                if (x.length == 0)
1785                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1786                double minval = x[0];
1787                int minidx = 0;
1788                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1789                        if (x[i] < minval) {
1790                                minval = x[i];
1791                                minidx = i;
1792                        }
1793                }
1794                return minidx;
1795        }
1796        
1797        /**
1798         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1799         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1800         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1801         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1802         * 
1803         * @param x a vector
1804         * @return the index of the smallest value
1805         */
1806        public static int idxMin(float[] x) {
1807                if (x.length == 0)
1808                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1809                float minval = x[0];
1810                int minidx = 0;
1811                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1812                        if (x[i] < minval) {
1813                                minval = x[i];
1814                                minidx = i;
1815                        }
1816                }
1817                return minidx;
1818        }
1819        
1820        
1821        /**
1822         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1823         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1824         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1825         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1826         * 
1827         * @param x a vector
1828         * @return the index of the largest value
1829         */
1830        public static int idxMax(double[] x) {
1831                if (x.length == 0)
1832                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1833                double maxval = x[0];
1834                int maxidx = 0;
1835                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1836                        if (x[i] > maxval) {
1837                                maxval = x[i];
1838                                maxidx = i;
1839                        }
1840                }
1841                return maxidx;
1842        }
1843        
1844        /**
1845         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1846         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1847         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1848         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1849         * 
1850         * @param x a vector
1851         * @return the index of the largest value
1852         */
1853        public static int idxMax(float[] x) {
1854                if (x.length == 0)
1855                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1856                float maxval = x[0];
1857                int maxidx = 0;
1858                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1859                        if (x[i] > maxval) {
1860                                maxval = x[i];
1861                                maxidx = i;
1862                        }
1863                }
1864                return maxidx;
1865        }
1866        
1867        
1868        /**
1869         * Returns the smallest value in the
1870         * specified vector. 
1871         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1872         * @param x a vector
1873         * @return the largest value
1874         */
1875        public static float min(final float[] x) {
1876                if (x.length == 0)
1877                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1878                float minval = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1879                for (float val : x) {
1880                        if (val < minval) {
1881                                minval = val;
1882                        }
1883                }
1884                return minval;
1885        }
1886        
1887        /**
1888         * Returns the smallest value in the
1889         * specified vector. 
1890         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1891         * @param x a vector
1892         * @return the largest value
1893         */
1894        public static double min(final double[] x) {
1895                if (x.length == 0)
1896                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1897                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1898                for (double val : x) {
1899                        if (val < minval) {
1900                                minval = val;
1901                        }
1902                }
1903                return minval;
1904        }
1905        
1906        /**
1907         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code double[]} vector.
