1908         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1909         * @param x a vector
1910         * @return the largest value
1911         */
1912        public static double max(final double[] x) {
1913                if (x.length == 0)
1914                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1915                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1916                for (double val : x) {
1917                        if (val > maxval) {
1918                                maxval = val;
1919                        }
1920                }
1921                return maxval;
1922        }
1923
1924        /**
1925         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code float[]} vector. 
1926         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1927         * @param x a vector
1928         * @return the largest value
1929         */
1930        public static float max(final float[] x) {
1931                if (x.length == 0)
1932                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1933                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1934                for (float val : x) {
1935                        if (val > maxval) {
1936                                maxval = val;
1937                        }
1938                }
1939                return maxval;
1940        }
1941        
1942        /**
1943         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code double[][]} matrix. 
1944         * @param A a matrix
1945         * @return the largest matrix value
1946         */
1947        public static double max(double[][] A) {
1948                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1949                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1950                        for (double val : A[r]) {
1951                                if (val > maxval) {
1952                                        maxval = val;
1953                                }
1954                        }
1955                }
1956                return maxval;
1957        }
1958        
1959        /**
1960         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code float[][]} matrix. 
1961         * @param A a matrix
1962         * @return the largest matrix value
1963         */
1964        public static float max(float[][] A) {
1965                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1966                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1967                        for (float val : A[r]) {
1968                                if (val > maxval) {
1969                                        maxval = val;
1970                                }
1971                        }
1972                }
1973                return maxval;
1974        }
1975        
1976        // Vector concatenation -----------------------
1977        
1978        /**
1979         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1980         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1981         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1982         */
1983        public static float[] join(float[]... xs) {
1984                int n = 0;
1985                for (float[] x : xs) {
1986                        n = n + x.length;
1987                }
1988                float[] va = new float[n];
1989                int j = 0;
1990                for (float[] x : xs) {
1991                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1992                                va[j] = x[i];
1993                                j++;
1994                        }
1995                }               
1996                return va;
1997        }
1998
1999        /**
2000         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
2001         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
2002         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
2003         */
2004        public static double[] join(double[]... xs) {
2005                int n = 0;
2006                for (double[] x : xs) {
2007                        n = n + x.length;
2008                }
2009                double[] va = new double[n];    
2010                int j = 0;
2011                for (double[] x : xs) {
2012                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2013                                va[j] = x[i];
2014                                j++;
2015                        }
2016                }               
2017                return va;
2018        }
2019        
2020        // Vector linear interpolation ---------------------------------
2021        
2022        /**
2023         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
2024         * which must have the same length.
2025         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
2026         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
2027         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
2028         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
2029         * @return the interpolated vector
2030         */
2031        public static float[] lerp(float[] a, float[] b, final float t) {
2032                final float[] c = new float[a.length];
2033                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2034                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
2035                }
2036                return c;
2037        }
2038        
2039        /**
2040         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
2041         * which must have the same length.
2042         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
2043         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
2044         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
2045         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
2046         * @return the interpolated vector
2047         */
2048        public static double[] lerp(double[] a, double[] b, final double t) {
2049                final double[] c = new double[a.length];
2050                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2051                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
2052                }
2053                return c;
2054        }
2055        
2056        
2057        // Homogeneous coordinates ---------------------------------
2058        
2059        /**
2060         * Converts a Cartesian vector to an equivalent homogeneous
2061         * vector by attaching an additional 1-element.
2062         * The resulting homogeneous vector is one element longer than the 
2063         * specified Cartesian vector.
2064         * See also {@link #toCartesian(double[])}.
2065         * @param xc a Cartesian vector
2066         * @return an equivalent homogeneous vector
2067         */
2068        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] xc) {
2069                double[] xh = new double[xc.length + 1];
2070                for (int i = 0; i < xc.length; i++) {
2071                        xh[i] = xc[i];
2072                        xh[xh.length - 1] = 1;
2073                }
2074                return xh;
2075        }
2076        
2077        /**
2078         * Converts a homogeneous vector to its equivalent Cartesian
2079         * vector, which is one element shorter.
2080         * See also {@link #toHomogeneous(double[])}.
2081         * @param xh a homogeneous vector
2082         * @return the equivalent Cartesian vector
2083         */
2084        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] xh) throws DivideByZeroException {
2085                double[] xc = new double[xh.length - 1];
2086                final double s = 1 / xh[xh.length - 1];
2087                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
2088                        throw new DivideByZeroException();
2089                for (int i = 0; i < xh.length - 1; i++) {
2090                        xc[i] = s * xh[i];
2091                }
2092                return xc;
2093        }
2094        
2095        // Determinants --------------------------------------------
2096        
2097        /**
2098         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given {@link RealMatrix}.
2099         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2100         * @param A a square matrix
2101         * @return the determinant
2102         */
2103        public static double determinant(RealMatrix A) {
2104                if (!A.isSquare())
2105                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2106                return new LUDecomposition(A).getDeterminant();
2107        }
2108        
2109        /**
2110         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2111         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2112         * @param A a square matrix
2113         * @return the determinant
2114         */
2115        public static double determinant(final double[][] A) {
2116                return determinant(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
2117        }
2118        
2119        /**
2120         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 2x2 {@code double[][]} matrix.
2121         * This method is hard-coded for the specific matrix size for better performance
2122         * than the general method ({@link #determinant(double[][])}).
2123         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 2x2.
2124         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
2125         * @return the determinant
2126         */
2127        public static double determinant2x2(final double[][] A) {
2128                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
2129                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2130                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
2131        }
2132        
2133        /**
2134         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 2x2 {@code float[][]} matrix.
2135         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 2x2.
2136         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
2137         * @return the determinant
2138         */
2139        public static float determinant2x2(final float[][] A) {
2140                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
2141                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2142                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
2143        }
2144        
2145
2146        /**
2147         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 3x3 {@code double[][]} matrix.
2148         * This method is hard-coded for the specific matrix size for better performance
2149         * than the general method ({@link #determinant(double[][])}).
2150         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 3x3.
2151         * @param A a 3x3 matrix
2152         * @return the determinant
2153         */
2154        public static double determinant3x3(final double[][] A) {
2155                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
2156                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2157                return 
2158                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] + 
2159                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0]     + 
2160                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] - 
2161                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] - 
2162                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] - 
2163                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
2164        }
2165        
2166        /**
2167         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 3x3 {@code float[][]} matrix.
2168         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 3x3.
2169         * @param A a 3x3 matrix
2170         * @return the determinant
2171         */
2172        public static float determinant3x3(final float[][] A) {
2173                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
2174                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2175                return
2176                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] +
2177                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0] +
2178                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] -
2179                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] -
2180                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] -
2181                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
2182        }
2183
2184
2185        
2186        // Matrix trace ---------------------------------------
2187        
2188        /**
2189         * Calculates and returns the trace of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2190         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2191         * @param A a square matrix
2192         * @return the trace 
2193         */
2194        public static double trace(final double[][] A) {
2195                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2196                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2197                if (m != n) 
2198                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2199                double s = 0;
2200                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2201                                s = s + A[i][i];
2202                }
2203                return s;
2204        }
2205        
2206        /**
2207         * Calculates and returns the trace of the given {@code float[][]} matrix.
2208         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2209         * @param A a square matrix
2210         * @return the trace 
2211         */
2212        public static float trace(final float[][] A) {
2213                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2214                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2215                if (m != n) 
2216                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2217                double s = 0;
2218                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2219                                s = s + A[i][i];
2220                }
2221                return (float) s;
2222        }
2223        
2224        // Matrix transposition ---------------------------------------
2225        
2226        /**
2227         * Returns the transpose of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2228         * The original matrix is not modified.
2229         * @param A a matrix
2230         * @return the transpose of the matrix
2231         */
2232        public static double[][] transpose(double[][] A) {
2233                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2234                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2235                double[][] At = new double[n][m];
2236                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2237                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
2238                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
2239                        }
2240                }
2241                return At;
2242        }
2243        
2244        /**
2245         * Returns the transpose of the given {@code float[][]} matrix.
2246         * The original matrix is not modified.
2247         * @param A a matrix
2248         * @return the transpose of the matrix
2249         */
2250        public static float[][] transpose(float[][] A) {
2251                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2252                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2253                float[][] At = new float[n][m];
2254                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2255                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
2256                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
2257                        }
2258                }
2259                return At;
2260        }
2261        
2262        
2263        // Checking vectors for all zero values  ------------------------------
2264        
2265        /**
2266         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[]} vector are zero
2267         * using the specified tolerance value.
2268         * @param x a vector
2269         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2270         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2271         */
2272        public static boolean isZero(double[] x, double tolerance) {
2273                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2274                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(x[i], tolerance)) {
2275                                return false;
2276                        }
2277                }
2278                return true;
2279        }
2280        
2281        /**
2282         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[]} vector are zero
2283         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2284         * @param x a vector
2285         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2286         */
2287        public static boolean isZero(double[] x) {
2288                return isZero(x, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
2289        }
2290        
2291        /**
2292         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code float[]} vector are zero
2293         * using the specified tolerance value.
2294         * @param x a vector
2295         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2296         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2297         */
2298        public static boolean isZero(float[] x, float tolerance) {
2299                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2300                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(x[i], tolerance)) {
2301                                return false;
2302                        }
2303                }
2304                return true;
2305        }
2306        
2307        /**
2308         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code float[]} vector are zero
2309         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2310         * @param x a vector
2311         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2312         */
2313        public static boolean isZero(float[] x) {
2314                return isZero(x, Arithmetic.EPSILON_FLOAT);
2315        }
2316        
2317        // Checking matrices for all zero values  ------------------------------
2318        
2319        /**
2320         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[][]} matrix are zero
2321         * using the specified tolerance value.
2322         * @param A a matrix
2323         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2324         * @return true if all matrix elements are smaller than the tolerance
2325         */
2326        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A, double tolerance) {
2327                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {    // for each matrix row i
2328                        if (!Matrix.isZero(A[i], tolerance)) {
2329                                return false;
2330                        }
2331                }
2332                return true;
2333        }
2334        
2335        /**
2336         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[][]} matrix are zero
2337         * using default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2338         * @param A a matrix
2339         * @return true if all matrix elements are smaller than the tolerance
2340         */
2341        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A) {
2342                return isZero(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
2343        }

2345        // Sorting vectors (non-destructively)  ------------------------------
2346        
2347        /**
2348         * Returns a sorted copy of the given {@code double[]} vector.
2349         * Elements are sorted by increasing value (smallest first).
2350         * 
2351         * @param x a {@code double[]} vector
2352         * @return a sorted copy of the vector
2353         */
2354        public static double[] sort(double[] x) {
2355                double[] y = Arrays.copyOf(x, x.length);
2356                Arrays.sort(y);
2357                return y;
2358        }
2359        
2360        /**
2361         * Returns a sorted copy of the given {@code float[]} vector.
2362         * Elements are sorted by increasing value (smallest first).
2363         * 
2364         * @param x a {@code float[]} vector
2365         * @return a sorted copy of the vector
2366         */
2367        public static float[] sort(float[] x) {
2368                float[] y = Arrays.copyOf(x, x.length);
2369                Arrays.sort(y);
2370                return y;
2371        }
2372        
2373        // Matrix inversion ---------------------------------------
2374        
2375        /**
2376         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
2377         * must be square. Exceptions are n if the supplied matrix is
2378         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
2379         * @param A a square matrix
2380         * @return the inverse matrix
2381         */
2382        public static double[][] inverse(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
2383                if (!isSquare(A))
2384                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2385                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
2386                return MatrixUtils.inverse(M).getData();
2387        }
2388        
2389        /**
2390         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
2391         * must be square. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
2392         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
2393         * @param A a square matrix
2394         * @return the inverse matrix
2395         */
2396        public static float[][] inverse(final float[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
2397                if (!isSquare(A))
2398                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2399                double[][] Ad = toDouble(A);
2400                return toFloat(inverse(Ad));
2401        }
2402
2403        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
2404        
2405        /**
2406         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
2407         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
2408         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
2409         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
2410         * Calls {@link #solve(RealMatrix, RealVector)}.
2411         * 
2412         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
2413         * @param b a vector of length n
2414         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
2415         */
2416        
2417        public static double[] solve(final double[][] A, double[] b) {
2418                RealVector x = solve(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), MatrixUtils.createRealVector(b));
2419                return (x == null) ? null : x.toArray();
2420        }
2421        
2422        /**
2423         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
2424         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
2425         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
2426         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
2427         * Uses {@link LUDecomposition} from the Apache Commons Math library.
2428         * 
2429         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
2430         * @param b a vector of length n
2431         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
2432         */
2433        public static RealVector solve(RealMatrix A, RealVector b) {
2434                if (!A.isSquare()) {
2435                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2436                }
2437                if (A.getRowDimension() != b.getDimension()) {
2438                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2439                }
2440//              DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A, 0.0).getSolver();
2441                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
2442                RealVector x = null;
2443                try {
2444                        x = solver.solve(b);
2445                } catch (SingularMatrixException e) {}
2446                return x;
2447        }
2448        
2449        // Output to strings and streams ------------------------------------------
2450        
2451        /**
2452         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2453         * @param a a vector
2454         * @return the string representation
2455         */
2456        public static String toString(double[] a) {
2457                if (a == null) {
2458                        return String.valueOf(a);
2459                }
2460                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2461                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2462                printToStream(a, strm);
2463                return bas.toString();
2464        }
2465        
2466        /**
2467         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2468         * @param a a vector
2469         * @return the string representation
2470         */
2471        public static String toString(float[] a) {
2472                if (a == null) {
2473                        return String.valueOf(a);
2474                }
2475                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2476                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2477                printToStream(a, strm);
2478                return bas.toString();
2479        }
2480        
2481        /**
2482         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2483         * @param a a vector
2484         * @return the string representation
2485         */
2486        public static String toString(RealVector a) {
2487                if (a == null) {
2488                        return String.valueOf(a);
2489                }
2490                else {
2491                        return toString(a.toArray());
2492                }
2493        }

2500        public static String toString(double[][] A) {
2501                if (A == null) {
2502                        return String.valueOf(A);
2503                }
2504                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2505                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2506                printToStream(A, strm);
2507                return bas.toString();
2508        }

2517                        return String.valueOf(A);
2518                }

2530        public static String toString(RealMatrix A) {

2539        // --------------------
2540        
2541        /**
2542         * Outputs a string representation of the given vector to
2543         * the specified output stream.
2544         * @param a the vector
2545         * @param strm the output stream
2546         * @see #toString(double[])
2547         */
2548        public static void printToStream(double[] a, PrintStream strm) {
2549                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2550                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2551                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2552                        if (i > 0)
2553                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
2554                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, a[i]);
2555                }
2556                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2557                strm.flush();
2558        }
2559        
2560        /**
2561         * Outputs a string representation of the given matrix to
2562         * the specified output stream.
2563         * @param A the matrix
2564         * @param strm the output stream
2565         * @see #toString(double[][])
2566         */
2567        public static void printToStream(double[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2568                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2569                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2570                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2571                        if (i == 0)
2572                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2573                        else
2574                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2575                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
2576                                if (j == 0) 
2577                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
2578                                else
2579                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2580                        }
2581                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2582                }
2583                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2584                strm.flush();
2585        }
2586        
2587        /**
2588         * Outputs a string representation of the given vector to
2589         * the specified output stream.
2590         * @param a the vector
2591         * @param strm the output stream
2592         * @see #toString(float[])
2593         */
2594        public static void printToStream(float[] a, PrintStream strm) {
2595                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2596                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2597                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2598                        if (i > 0)
2599                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
2600                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, a[i]);
2601                }
2602                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2603                strm.flush();
2604        }
2605        
2606        /**
2607         * Outputs a string representation of the given matrix to
2608         * the specified output stream.
2609         * @param A the matrix
2610         * @param strm the output stream
2611         * @see #toString(float[][])
2612         */
2613        public static void printToStream(float[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2614                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2615                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2616                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2617                        if (i == 0)
2618                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2619                        else
2620                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2621                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
2622                                if (j == 0) 
2623                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
2624                                else
2625                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2626                        }
2627                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2628                }
2629                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2630                strm.flush();
2631        }

2633        // Exceptions ----------------------------------------------------------------
2634        
2635        public static class IncompatibleDimensionsException extends RuntimeException {
2636                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
2637                
2638                public IncompatibleDimensionsException() {
2639                        super("incompatible matrix-vector dimensions");
2640                }
2641        }
2642        
2643        public static class NonsquareMatrixException extends RuntimeException {
2644                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
2645                
2646                public NonsquareMatrixException() {
2647                        super("square matrix expected");
2648                }
2649        }
2650        
2651        public static class SameSourceTargetException extends RuntimeException {
2652                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
2653                
2654                public SameSourceTargetException() {
2655                        super("source and target must not be the same");
2656                }
2657        }
2658        
2659        public static class ZeroLengthVectorException extends RuntimeException {
2660                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
2661                
2662                public ZeroLengthVectorException() {
2663                        super("vector length must be greater that 0");
2664                }
2665        }

2669//      public static void main(String[] args) {
2670//              double s = Double.NaN;
2671//              s = -1.0 / 1E-200; // / 1E-200;
2672//              System.out.println(Double.isFinite(s));
2673//              System.out.println((double[]) null);
2674//              
2675//              double[][] A = makeDoubleMatrix(5, 4,
2676//                              1,2,3,4,
2677//                              5,6,7,8,
2678//                              9,10,11,12,
2679//                              13,14,15,16,
2680//                              17,18,19,20);
2681//              System.out.println("A = \n" + toString(A));
